TITLE: What to know about the latest 1099-K tax reporting change for Venmo, PayPal
SUMMARY: The IRS has issued a one-year delay for the 1099-K tax reporting change, applying to business transfers over $600. Here's what taxpayers need to know.

TITLE: Here's what Secure 2.0 means for you if you're getting close to retirement
SUMMARY: While the changes included in Secure 2.0 are intended to improve outcomes for everyone, some provisions are particularly useful to near-retirees.

TITLE: New retirement account rules make it easier to tap savings early for emergencies
SUMMARY: The $1.7 trillion bill to fund the federal government through next September has measures related to tapping retirement savings for financial hardships.

TITLE: 3 big questions the Supreme Court is likely to ask when determining the fate of student loan forgiveness
SUMMARY: In deciding the fate of student loan forgiveness, the Supreme Court may consider if the plan causes harm or is an overstep of executive authority.

TITLE: Use this calculation to find the best used car for your money — plus 10 models that come out on top
SUMMARY: A recent report looks at the cost per remaining mile to determine which used cars are the best deal.

TITLE: Hope Global Forums rallies business leaders for financial literacy, ‘so that everyone learns the language of money’
SUMMARY: During the Hope Global Forums, an annual meeting for nonprofit Operation Hope, CEOs, influencers and other leaders gathered to talk about financial literacy.

TITLE: From 'quiet quitting' to 'loud layoffs,' will career trends that created a buzz in 2022 continue in the new year?
SUMMARY: New buzzwords like "loud layoffs" for workplace dilemmas were coined in 2022. Experts say companies with the best solutions will attract and retain top talent.

TITLE: Travel abroad is poised 'for a big comeback' in 2023 as Americans eye trips to Asia, Europe
SUMMARY: Travel abroad will boom in 2023. Some 31% of Americans more interested in international than domestic travel, according to Destination Analysts.

TITLE: Don't let these 3 credit myths cost you money next year as interest rates rise
SUMMARY: One of the costliest misconceptions is that carrying a small balance from month to month will give your credit score a boost.

TITLE: IRS delays tax reporting change for 1099-K on Venmo, Paypal business payments
SUMMARY: Tax professionals and consumers are likely to cheer the delay, which means the pre-2022 threshold of $20,000 for more than 200 transactions applies for now.

TITLE: 'Secure 2.0' clears Congress as part of omnibus appropriations bill, will bring more changes to U.S. retirement system
SUMMARY: Both chambers of Congress have now approved an omnibus government-funding bill, which includes dozens of retirement-related provisions known as "Secure 2.0."

TITLE: New government funding package includes 'historic step forward' for pregnant workers, new mothers
SUMMARY: Two changes to provide additional protections for pregnant and breastfeeding people will make a huge difference for low-wage workers, one advocate says.

TITLE: Families can make a tax-free rollover from 529 plans to Roth individual retirement accounts starting in 2024
SUMMARY: Lawmakers say new rules would rescue funds from tax penalties and promote more college savings. Others think the measure amounts to a tax break for wealthy.

TITLE: What to know about the two student loan forgiveness cases the Supreme Court will hear legal arguments on in February
SUMMARY: Two of the legal challenges brought against President Joe Biden's student loan forgiveness plan have reached the U.S. Supreme Court.

TITLE: Two of the 'best' ways to donate to maximize your tax deduction for charitable gifts, according to financial advisors
SUMMARY: If you're giving to charity this holiday season, it may be possible to lower your taxes, experts say. Here's what to know about the charitable deduction.

TITLE: Congress’ lame duck session leaves 'unfinished business' on issues that address Americans' everyday financial needs
SUMMARY: Here's what didn't make the cut in year-end legislation and how lawmakers could address that "unfinished business" in 2023.

TITLE: 'Secure 2.0' would provide a limited federal 'match' on contributions for retirement savers with lower income
SUMMARY: The provision would provide up to a 50% federal match on contributions to qualifying retirement accounts for people with income below set levels.

TITLE: Here are 10 ways to avoid the early withdrawal penalty for individual retirement accounts
SUMMARY: Savers can access individual retirement account funds before 59½ without a 10% penalty in some cases. But it's generally not a good idea to raid savings early.

TITLE: Emergency savings provisions in 'Secure 2.0' may help shore up short- and long-term financial security, experts say
SUMMARY: New retirement legislation will make it easier to set aside money for unexpected emergency expenses.

TITLE: Some Wells Fargo customers have already received their share of the $2 billion misconduct settlement. Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: The bank agreed to a settlement with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, which includes $2 billion for affected consumers across a variety of accounts.

TITLE: Pell Grants could rise to a maximum $7,395 next year, in the biggest increase in over a decade
SUMMARY: As part of its massive $1.7 trillion spending package for 2023, Congress is planning to up the maximum annual Pell Grant award to $7,395 — a $500 increase.

TITLE: The 'Secure 2.0' retirement legislation leaves a 'huge problem untouched,' labor economist warns. How these changes could help
SUMMARY: New legislation may help make it easier to automatically enroll workers in retirement plans. But to keep retirees out of poverty, more fixes are necessary.

TITLE: As the cost of living skyrockets, nearly 1 in 3 adults rely on their parents for financial support
SUMMARY: Amid sky-high inflation, many young adults see their parents as a financial safety net. Some live with their parents, and others get help with their bills.

TITLE: 'Young adults are particularly vulnerable to delinquencies' — 1 in 5 have debt in collections, new report finds
SUMMARY: With little to no safety net, lower wages and shorter credit histories, young adults are struggling to manage high-interest debt, according to a new report.

TITLE: Hagerty, Manchin propose $10,000 threshold for Venmo, PayPal tax reporting change — up from $600
SUMMARY: Sens. Bill Hagerty and Joe Manchin will propose an amendment to the spending package to increase the threshold for Form 1099-K from $600 to $10,000.

TITLE: Supreme Court likely to 'dismantle' student loan forgiveness plan after it hears case, says Harvard law professor
SUMMARY: U.S. Supreme Court justices have scheduled high-profile arguments over President Joe Biden's student loan forgiveness plan for Feb. 28.

TITLE: 'Secure 2.0' is part of the $1.7 trillion spending bill, putting it on track to usher in retirement system improvements
SUMMARY: The omnibus appropriations bill, which includes a variety of retirement-system changes, is expected to clear Congress this week.

TITLE: This 'wild card' strategy can help retirees with unpaid quarterly taxes before year-end
SUMMARY: If you're retired and missed quarterly estimated tax payments for 2022, there's still a chance to avoid late penalties. Here's what to know.

TITLE: Long Covid patients can face a battle trying to claim benefits through their workplace disability insurance
SUMMARY: Given some of the subjective symptoms of long Covid, there's no guarantee that a claim filed for short- or long-term disability insurance will be approved.

TITLE: Average Social Security retirement benefit fell short by 46% in 2022. Here are the costs that went up the most
SUMMARY: High inflation outpaced a record Social Security cost-of-living adjustment this year. Here's the prices that rose the fastest for households ages 65 and up.
